text: PI3-kinase and <extra_id_0> PDK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Mediate the Increase in Akt Thr308 Phosphorylation Under Necroptotic Conditions

Typical regulation of Akt by growth factors involves its recruitment to the plasma membrane , which is mediated by the binding of the pleckstrin homology ( PH ) domain of Akt to the product of PI3K , phosphatidylinositol-3 , 4 , 5-triphosphate ( PIP3 ) .

In the membrane , Akt is phosphorylated on Thr308 and Ser473 by <extra_id_0> 3-phosphoinositide dependent protein kinase-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> PDK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and mTORC2 ( or DNA-PK ) , respectively [ 35 ] .

Since our results showed that only Thr308 Akt phosphorylation is increased during necroptosis , we next examined whether it is still dependent on PI3K and <extra_id_0> PDK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Inhibition of PI3K and <extra_id_0> PDK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> using the specific inhibitors LY249002 and BX912 [ 36 ] resulted in the efficient inhibition of cell death and Akt Thr308 phosphorylation ( Fig .
Likewise , siRNA knockdown of <extra_id_0> PDK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protected cells from death and inhibited Akt Thr308 phosphorylation ( Fig .
S7E , F ) Therefore , PI3K and <extra_id_0> PDK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity is still required for non-canonical Akt activation during necroptosis .
